result.execSummary:
The defendant Franklin M Love Nolden was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver Cocaine (<=1g), a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(cm)1g.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Pay $200 restitution to the La Crosse Police Dept / MEG Unit (no surcharge is assessed on this)

Restitution will be paid under the terms of a payment plan to be established with the PO but calling for no less than 2.5% of gross wages to be paid toward restitution and to be enforced through a wage assignment
.

Obtain and maintain full-time employment or course of education or a combination of both that equals full-time
.

Def to undergo Alcohol and Drug Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommendations.
.

Def is not to consume or possess any alcohol or controlled substances without a prescription from licensed physician, with random testing
.

Pay Crime Lab and Drug Assessment fee (see 'other' above for amount)

Pay DOC Supervision fees

Credit for 5 days if probation is ever revoked

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of resititution victims and/or govermental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt

timeConds.notes:
The defendant is to complete 100 hours of Community Service during each year of probation
.
.

superMiscConds.notes:
Def to undergo Alcohol and Drug Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommendations.
.

Def is not to consume or possess any alcohol or controlled substances without a prescription from licensed physician, with random screenings.

No contact with any known drug users/dealers.
.

Pay DOC Supervision fees.

Make payment toward any outstanding finacial obligations.

  Undergo any other assessments or evaluations deemed appropriate by PO and follow through with any treatment recommendations.
.

Plea: 12/11 @ 9
Plea/sentencing hearing on December 11, 2014 at 09:00 am.

Justice Sanctions Violations notice, filed.
SLH: note & file- addressed 9/25

2:30 PM - Def in court w/Atty Fabio Anthony Burgos.  Emily E. Hynek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
JS violations - positive tests.
Burgos: he's con't to test since then. I have tried to call him but VM isn't set  up. That was also the date of the prelim. He's having a hard time coping, not ony w/ this case but personal problems too. He has been told by JS to call Coulee Council but he doesn't have ins. He's testing and the only thing he's tested + for is THC. 
Hynek: no position
Crt: you are on bond for delivery of cocaine and it's a conditon that you not use controlled sub w/o RX and for you to test. I give you credit for testing, but I am concerned of the con't use pattern and that's unacceptable. This is a community rich in resources to help those w/ an addiction but you have to make yourself in a position to use those.  I have 3 options...  You were told to go to Coulee Coucil and find resources available; support groups, etc. Affordable Care Act carries provisions for abuse trmt and if that option is available to you you are responsible for taking that. I expect you to take advantage of the open enrollment in Nov and get treatment and then follow the plan.
BOND MODIFICATION:  W/in the next week he's to go to Coulee Council then he has to make application to St. Claire's mission to see if they can help you and sign releases for JSS to monitor your treatment. 
ejs
